intro: Durio conicus, commonly known as the helmet durian, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, spiky, and highly aromatic fruit, which is often referred to as the "king of fruits." The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae and is closely related to other members of the Durio genus. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The fruit develops from a single flower and can weigh up to 10 kilograms, making it one of the heaviest fruits in the world.
